channel.title: What game(s) did you buy today?
channel.description:
In the same spirit of the game played thread but for games you've just bought.
----
Today I bought Persona 4 Golden for the PS Vita. It was a completely blind buy and I have not played it yet.
As someone who never played a single game in the entire franchise and does not play jRPGs at all, what's some good advice you can give me before I dive into the game?

item.title: What game(s) did you buy today?
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
Not all today but during the Steam sale I picked up the new XCOM and its expansion, the Talos Principle, and one of Dishonored’s DLCs.

item.title: What game(s) did you buy today?
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
MGSV: Ground Zeroes.
I was planning on getting it when The Phantom Pain came out, but then one of my roommates told me it was on sale for $5. (Which I didn’t have in my Steam Wallet)
A quick exchange of cash got another roommate to buy it and gift it to me.

So excited.

Read full topic
item.source: What game(s) did you buy today?

item.title: What game(s) did you buy today?
item.dc:creator: Shaddy
item.description:
Dunno if it counts since I don’t actually have it but my local game shop was out of copies of Splatoon so I ordered it elsewhere and it should be here on Wednesday.

But I’m not sure if I’ve had any package I’ve ordered ever arrive on time in my life, so.

Read full topic

item.title: What game(s) did you buy today?
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Space Station 13. I think I may discovered one of my new favorite bugs.

I managed to set up my character’s medical records with some fancy custom formatting. You can view them just fine at a console, but viewing them from any handheld PDA will instantly brick the thing. It’s amazing. That’s not even supposed to be possible.

Edit: Why do I keep thinking this is the other thread? Pah.

Read full topic
item.source: What game(s) did you buy today?

item.title: What game(s) did you buy today?
item.dc:creator: Jethrosoup
item.description:
Transistor! I’ve put it off more than long enough. I loved Bastion so much, I can’t believe it’s taken me this long to play Transistor. Anyway, it’s very good. A lot more challenging than Bastion. Which… isn’t saying much, because Bastion wasn’t exactly known for its difficultly. But I’m having a lot of fun with it.

Read full topic
item.source: What game(s) did you buy today?

item.title: What game(s) did you buy today?
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Redux has a load of visual improvements, the HUD and a load of new features from Last Light, and runs waaaay better.

The first time I launched, I had a major “holy shit” moment when I realized that the camera flythrough at the start isn’t pre-rendered.

Read full topic
item.source: What game(s) did you buy today?

item.title: What game(s) did you buy today?
item.dc:creator: BendyBread
item.description:
Metro 2033: Redux

I haven’t played much of the original so it’s hard to make comparisons (I only got to like chapter 2 in it?), but does anyone know full extent of graphical updates/changes between the games and has the time to explain it? I’ve looked up a bunch of stuff and lots of people seem to say it looks worse now, though I can’t tell if they’re saying it factually or out of bias/nostalgia.

For example reading this - https://www.pcworld.com/article/2466623/metro-2033/metro-redux-review-the-definitive-way-to-play-metro-2033-and-metro-last-light.html
Redux just seems better by far, but I can’t tell if the removed particles are cause he has an AMD card and Phys X turned off, or if they’re just gone (in which case thats a little sad, smoke and dust particles are so pretty).

Read full topic
item.source: What game(s) did you buy today?
